description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣

**#Course Description**

**Grading Policies**

**A) Punctual attendance**, **lesson preparation** and **active participation** are required. Participation also includes teamwork and group discussion.

*   All absences will be classified as excused or unexcused.
*   Absences for the following reasons will be _excused_ if there is timely verification (within 1 week) of such reasons provided to the instructor:

*   Illness or medical emergency
*   Family emergencies
*   Pre-arranged medical appointments.
*   Pre-arranged school-sponsored activities, such as field trips.

*   A Notification of Absence Form has to be submitted online (學生請假系統) within 1 week. Verification document (hard-copy) should also be handed in to the instructor within 1 week. Late submission will not be accepted.
*   Students who are more than 30 minutes late to class will be considered absent.
*   Students will fail this course if there are more than 3 unexcused absences.
*   Students will fail this course if they miss more than 5 meetings the whole semester.

**B)** This semester you have to turn in a special assignment related to the school-assigned Lexile novel.  The details of this assignment will be given at the beginning of this semester, and as always, please submit them to me as scheduled.

**C)** A project will be held in this semester. You can use multimedia and all kinds of resources (apps, props, costumes, photos, etc.) to make your project interesting to the audience. It must be done in English. The length of your project presentation should be no shorter than 4 minutes. More details about this project will be given in class.

**D)** In order to improve your extensive reading skills and discussion skills, Lexile novel is assigned as an  outside reading for you to practice high level reading skills and Quality Talk Q&A skills (QT: Q&A). Your instructor will teach you the essence of QT, the most frequently used 6 types of questions and responses. Each student must try to ask as many questions as possible, give responses as many as possible, proving that you really understand how to ask questions and give responses in order to elicit important information and stimulate further thoughts.

**E)** Check Course Group Page and email frequently  
I assume that you check your email and the course site frequently. It’s your responsibility to make sure you register with the correct email address on course group page. Without receiving a notice is NOT an excuse for any late submission. Late submission will be penalized 10% per day.

**!! More details will be updated or given in class!!**
